se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.api.collections

Class CollectionAlgorithms

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.api.collections.CollectionAlgorithms

  • public abstract class CollectionAlgorithms
extends Object
    A suite of frequently used functional algorithms.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

      • create

        public static <T> List<T> create(Enumeration<T> source)
        Copies the elements from the provided Enumeration into a List.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of element found within the provided enumeration source.
        Parameters:
        source - The enumeration from which to copy all elements.
        Returns:
        A List holding all elements of the provided source.

      • aggregate

        public static <T,R> R aggregate(Collection<T> source,
                                Aggregator<T,R> aggregator)
        Aggregates (reduces) the provided source to a single result, by applying the aggregator's aggregate method to all elements within the source Collection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to operate on.
        R - The result type.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Collection holding T instances.
        aggregator - The aggregator used to aggregate a source element with the current result.
        Returns:
        An aggregate over the entire collection.

      • forAll

        public static <T> void forAll(Collection<T> source,
                              Operation<T> operation)
        Performs a no-return operation for all elements within the source collection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to operate on.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Collection holding T instances.
        operation - The void-returning operation which should be performed for all elements within the collection.

      • filter

        public static <T,C extends Collection<T>> C filter(C source,
                                                   Filter<T> selector)
        Filters the provided collection using the given selector.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to filter.
        C - The Collection type which should be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Collection holding T instances.
        selector - The T-type filter
        Returns:
        A new Collection holding the unique instances from the source list accepted by the GenericFilter (shallow copy, not deep-clone'd elements).

      • filter

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> filter(Map<K,V> source,
                                    Filter<Tuple<K,V>> selector)
        Filters the provided Map using the given selector.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The key type of the Map.
        V - The value type of the Map.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Map holding Entries of [K, V] instances.
        selector - The Filter selector for the provided Map
        Returns:
        A new Map holding the instances from the source map accepted by the GeneriFilter (shallow copy, not deep-clone'd elements).

      • transform

        public static <T,R,C extends Collection<R>> C transform(Collection<T> source,
                                                        Transformer<T,R> transformer)
        Transforms (maps) each element within the source collection using the provided transformer, returning the result in form of a Collection of transformed instances.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The source collection type.
        R - The response (transformed) collection type.
        C - The Collection type.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Collection holding T instances.
        transformer - The transformer used to produce each R element from a T element.
        Returns:
        A new Collection holding the transformed instances from the source.

      • flatten

        public static <K,V,T> List<T> flatten(Map<K,V> source,
                                      Transformer<Tuple<K,V>,T> transformer)
        Flattens (maps) each element within the source Map[K, V] using the provided transformer, returning the result in form of a Collection of transformed instances.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The key type of the source map.
        V - The value type of the source map.
        T - The type of the returned Collection.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Map holding entries of [K, V] objects.
        transformer - The transformer used to produce a T instance from each [K, V] entry within source.
        Returns:
        A List holding T instances.

      • transform

        public static <K1,V1,K2,V2> Map<K2,V2> transform(Map<K1,V1> source,
                                                 Transformer<Tuple<K1,V1>,Tuple<K2,V2>> transformer)
        Transforms the sourceMap to a resulting Map using the provided transformer.
        Type Parameters:
        K1 - The key type in the source Map.
        V1 - The value type in the source Map.
        K2 - The key type in the result Map.
        V2 - The value type in the result Map.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Map holding entries of [K1, V1] objects.
        transformer - The transformer used to produce entries of [K2, V2] from each entry of [K1, V1] within source.
        Returns:
        A new Map holding the transformed Entries from the source Map.

      • map

        public static <K,V,T> Map<K,V> map(Collection<T> source,
                                   Transformer<T,Tuple<K,V>> transformer)
        Transforms (maps) each element within the source collection using the provided transformer, returning the result in form of a Map of the Tuple pair instances. Note! Only non-null Tuples returned by the transformer are mapped into the returned Map.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The source collection type.
        K - The key type of the returned Map.
        V - The value type of the returned Map.
        Parameters:
        source - The non-null source Collection holding T instances.
        transformer - The transformer used to produce each R element from a T element.
        Returns:
        A Map containing the non-null Tuples generated by the Tuple transformer.

      • enumerate

        public static <T> Enumeration<T> enumerate(Collection<T> source)
        Extracts a typed old-style Enumeration from the provided Collection source.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of element enumerated by the returned Enumeration.
        Parameters:
        source - The source Collection.
        Returns:
        An Enumeration iterating over the provided source.
